conclusion: Displacement is calculated as the area under the v-t graph during the given time interval.
For each car, the displacement during t = 0 to t = t1 is equal to the area enclosed by its respective v-t curve and the time axis.
Car A starts at velocity v2 at t = 0 and decreases linearly to velocity v1 at t = t1, forming a straight line sloping downward.
The area under the v-t graph for Car A forms a triangular shape.
The displacement for Car A can be calculated using the formula for the area of a triangle: Area = 1/2 × base × height, where base = t1 and height = v2 - v1.
The displacement for Car A is 1/2 × t1 × (v2 - v1).
Car B starts at velocity v1 at t = 0 and increases linearly to velocity v2 at t = t1, forming a straight line sloping upward.
The area under the v-t graph for Car B forms a triangular shape.
The displacement for Car B can be calculated using the formula for the area of a triangle: Area = 1/2 × base × height, where base = t1 and height = v2 - v1.
The displacement for Car B is 1/2 × t1 × (v2 - v1).
The displacement for Car A is 1/2 × t1 × (v2 - v1), and the displacement for Car B is also 1/2 × t1 × (v2 - v1).
Since the displacements for Car A and Car B are identical, their displacements are the same during the time interval t = 0 to t = t1.
Yes, the displacements of cars A and B are the same during the time interval t = 0 to t = t1.
